messages: 2bced84601674aac32eab2adc16fb8d4 (10:28): anyone know if there is a way to make one set of particles not be affected by fields?
2bced84601674aac32eab2adc16fb8d4 (10:40): nm i figured it out... apperently you have to set a group with a field in it, that has a strength of 0
b7cfbed8c323ab16f7c780635cafa9c6 (10:44): Anyone knows any tuts about modelling Spacecrafts?
2bced84601674aac32eab2adc16fb8d4 (10:52): i dont know about any tuts, but i would start by looking at real-world things as a basis
b7cfbed8c323ab16f7c780635cafa9c6 (10:53): Well.. i was kinda looking for modelling techniques
042a4eecf5ecfe07b027c8ea5e492d5c (10:53): You'd probably want to start with something else then.
b7cfbed8c323ab16f7c780635cafa9c6 (10:53): Coz i am missing one tool.
b7cfbed8c323ab16f7c780635cafa9c6 (10:53): Hmm how would i describe it..
b7cfbed8c323ab16f7c780635cafa9c6 (10:54): It kinda lets one do split an line of polys into two differend sets of polys..
042a4eecf5ecfe07b027c8ea5e492d5c (10:54): it only works on selected faces
042a4eecf5ecfe07b027c8ea5e492d5c (10:56): That's the tool I had to spend a day looking for when first starting out
b7cfbed8c323ab16f7c780635cafa9c6 (10:56): Hmm.. Well  that works too.
b7cfbed8c323ab16f7c780635cafa9c6 (10:56): But i remember there was a bit differend kind of tool for this also
b7cfbed8c323ab16f7c780635cafa9c6 (10:56): But thanks for this.. this will help a lot
0876499d1078a8e555f9ca63dad5632d (10:58): can i get an opinion on my model?
042a4eecf5ecfe07b027c8ea5e492d5c (10:58): ah, neat.  haven't fooled with that yet
b7cfbed8c323ab16f7c780635cafa9c6 (10:59): Walugo The fingers look bit "pointy" to mee.
0876499d1078a8e555f9ca63dad5632d (10:59): you can also press K for the knife menu
0876499d1078a8e555f9ca63dad5632d (10:59): want to see it on the whole model?
2bced84601674aac32eab2adc16fb8d4 (11:05): i need better internet then dialup
a3d687f79ff6d2b86bfdfe8d014fcb16 (11:06): cool, you plan to rig it then ;D
0876499d1078a8e555f9ca63dad5632d (11:06): it's either........ 8k or 12k polys......... blender says it's 8k but when i render it it says 12k
a3d687f79ff6d2b86bfdfe8d014fcb16 (11:06): mind if i ask which one ?
a3d687f79ff6d2b86bfdfe8d014fcb16 (11:07): so how many pre-subsurfed vertexes ?
2bced84601674aac32eab2adc16fb8d4 (11:07): thats on of the things i need to figure out how to do... rigging
a3d687f79ff6d2b86bfdfe8d014fcb16 (11:08): oh.. thought it was less
0876499d1078a8e555f9ca63dad5632d (11:08): and 3k polys when it's subsurfed level 1
a3d687f79ff6d2b86bfdfe8d014fcb16 (11:08): still shouldnt be too hard to rig ;)
0876499d1078a8e555f9ca63dad5632d (11:09): duplicate the left hand and scale it inversely...then connect to right arm
a3d687f79ff6d2b86bfdfe8d014fcb16 (11:10): its not going to ware shoes
2bced84601674aac32eab2adc16fb8d4 (11:10): then you would still need toes
0876499d1078a8e555f9ca63dad5632d (11:11): it needs to be able to show toes
0876499d1078a8e555f9ca63dad5632d (11:11): last question i have to face tho...
a3d687f79ff6d2b86bfdfe8d014fcb16 (11:14): well are they needed in your project or not ?
0876499d1078a8e555f9ca63dad5632d (11:14): but i think it'd be funny to animate them along with the jiggling fat
0876499d1078a8e555f9ca63dad5632d (11:22): meh, i'll finish it tomarrow.... i've got the hands done and that's all that i care about now
785b6c5eb00e035cb34e3f5a10887595 (11:33): hmm I wish I could find some good tutorial how to use pompositing nodes to render different 'layers'
785b6c5eb00e035cb34e3f5a10887595 (11:33): and how to add another image to same UV mapping but for use as reflection, or bump
0876499d1078a8e555f9ca63dad5632d (11:35): and in "map input" tab select UV
785b6c5eb00e035cb34e3f5a10887595 (11:36): thanks, Ive written it down. will test later to see if I can get reflection on the windows
785b6c5eb00e035cb34e3f5a10887595 (11:37): I assume a black (no reflection) and white (reflection) should be used
0876499d1078a8e555f9ca63dad5632d (11:38): just hover your mouse over the buttons on those places
785b6c5eb00e035cb34e3f5a10887595 (11:39): (search for "Groningen 3D" on google, it will be one of the top results (latest is v12)
0876499d1078a8e555f9ca63dad5632d (11:41): looks nice for the poly count
